title: News24.com | Weather Updates: Heavy rain forecast as Tropical Storm #Dineo approaches
text:
{{item.title}} 
Cape Town - The South African Weather Service has forecast a 60% chance of rain along the East Coast from Port Edward in KwaZulu-Natal up to the Mozambican border at the northernmost part of the East Coast on Tuesday, 14 February. 
The adjacent interior over the southern and central parts of Mpumalanga, over Gauteng and in the eastern parts of the Free State can also expect a 60% chance of rain. 
Tropical Storm approaching 
This heavy rainfall comes as the SA Weather Service has also confirmed that various regions over Limpopo and Mpumalanga may be affected by a Tropical Storm 'Dineo', which is due to make landfall in Mozambique on Tuesday. 
According to the SA Weather Service, "The weather system has the potential to result in severe weather impacts over the north-eastern parts of the country later this week," especially in parts of the Mpumalanga and Limpopo provinces. 
SEE: ALERT: Tropical storm #Dineo closes in, affected SA areas identified 
The north-eastern part of South Africa can expect rain until Wednesday, 15 February. 
For Tuesday, the areas over the North West, Gauteng, southern parts of Limpopo, northern parts of Mpumalanga as well as the central and north-eastern parts of the Eastern Cape can expect a 30% chance of rain. 
While good rains have been falling across the country, the western parts of the Northern Cape and the whole of the Western Cape remain in the grips of a severe drought, with dam levels remain at a critical low.

Temperatures 
Temperatures across the country on Tuesday will be warm in the east and hot in the Northern Cape while very hot in the northernmost parts of the country in Limpopo and the Northern Cape. 
The hottest places in SA will be Upington in the Northern Cape and Phalaborwa and Musina in Limpopo, all reaching a high peak of 37°C on Tuesday. 
Johannesburg in Gauteng will reach a high of 24°C, while Pretoria will be 33°C and Bloemfontein in the Free State will peak at 30°C.

Along the rest of the coastal regions of SA, Cape Town in the Western Cape will reach a high of 22°C, while Durban on the East Coast will be 26°C. Port Elizabeth in the Eastern Cape will see a high of 25°C.
